relevant_findings.initial_exam: Severe closed head injury with Glasgow Coma Scale score of 3
relevant_findings.condition: Patient required tracheal intubation and mechanical ventilation

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Intracranial pressure progressively increased to 25 mmHg despite treatment

relevant_findings.abdominal_exam: Severe brain injury with extradural hematoma, facial trauma, and fractures
relevant_findings.cardiac_monitoring: Electrocardiographic monitoring showed sinus rhythm with rare PVC
relevant_findings.arrhythmias: Frequent PVCs (5-25 per minute) during hospital course

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Prolonged periods of ventricular bigeminy and short periods of VT observed during 8 days
